TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1144

barker_notes.barker_summary: Bill of sale for cotton gin. George Huff to John Austin, July 3, 1825.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1144

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Bill of sale for cotton gin. George Huff to John Austin, July 3, 1825.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Know all men by these presents that I *person_mentioned*George Huff*/person_mentioned* do bargin and sell to *person_mentioned*John Austin*/person_mentioned* a *location_mentioned*cotton Gin*/location_mentioned* stand with every thing belonging to it now at the *location_mentioned*House of *person_mentioned*Said (Austin)*/person_mentioned* on Buffaloe Byou*/location_mentioned*, which *location_mentioned*(Gin,)*/location_mentioned* I warrant to be of a good quality and without fault—for the sum of Four Hundred and Fifty Dollars, all of which I have received *location_mentioned*Head of Buffalo Byou*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="07-03-1825">July 3rd 1825*/date_mentioned*—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Geo Huff*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
